data.description: A list of specialrule definitions where the keys a the specialrule IDs.

^[a-z][a-z1-9]$.description: ID of a specialrule. This is either two letters or a letter and a number and must be unique across all rulebooks.

label.description: Label of this specialrule. Note that the actual display text comes from a locales file.

personality.description: Does this specialrule makes an unit a personality?

generic.description: Indicates that this is a generic specialrule that needs specification in the unit.

replaces.description: IDs of other specialrules that are replaced by this specialrule (e.g. 'Shooter (long)' replaces 'Shooter (medium)'). "replaces" needs to be set only once; it is handled recursively. This is for convenience in the editor.

variants.description: IDs of specialrules that are variants of this specialrule. Variants mutually exclude each other and are recursive (e.g. if "A,B are variants" and "B,C are variants", then C and A are also variants. "variants" needs to be set only once; they are handled recursively.

excludes.description: IDs of other specialrules that an unit can't have along with this specialrule. In contrast to "variants" excludes work one-way and are not mutual (e.g. when "A excludes B,C" it is perfectly fine for an unit having B and C as long as it doesn't also have A). Excludes apply also to variants.

pooling.description: Indicates that this specialrule creates a separate pool point on the unit's warband.
